Dainja's Career & Season Game-By-Game Stats (PDF)

2023-24 Junior

One of six Illini to play in all 37 games this season

Ranked sixth on the team in both scoring (6.3 ppg) and rebounds (3.7 rpg)

Team-leading 68.2% from the field (101-148)

Set the Illinois program record for consecutive field goals made at 20 (3/17-28), a streak that spanned 6 postseason games (3/15-28).

Totaled 7 points and 6 rebounds (3 offensive) vs. Iowa State in NCAA Tournament Sweet 16 (3/28)

Scored season-high 21 points (9-9 FGs) and tied season bests of 8 rebounds and 2 blocks vs. Morehead St. (3/21)

Posted 9 points (4-4 FGs) and 7 rebounds (2 off.) in a season-most 22:36 in BTT Championship vs. Wisconsin (3/17)

Scored 18 points (most since 12/29 vs. FDU) and pulled down a season-high tying 8 rebounds in BTT quarterfinal win over Ohio State (3/15/24)

Recorded 9 points (his most in a road game this season), 5 rebounds, and 2 blocks at Iowa (3/10)

Scored 11 points, his sixth game in double-figures, and added 6 rebounds vs. Minnesota (2/28)

Tallied 6 points and a game-high 8 rebounds (3 offensive) vs. Iowa (2/24)

Scored 2 points at the free-throw line in 2 minutes at Penn State (2/21)

Recorded 4 points and six rebounds in 12 minutes vs. Michigan (2/13)

Tallied 2 points at the FT line and added a rebound in 7 minutes at Michigan State (2/10)

Notched 6 points, 3 rebounds and a block in 9 minutes in home win over Nebraska (2/4)

Posted 7 points, 5 rebounds and a block in 11 minutes of road win at Ohio State (1/30)

2 points and 1 steal in 5 minutes in win vs. Indiana (1/27)

4 points on 2-for-2 FGs in home win over Rutgers (1/21)

7 points, including 3-of-4 FTs, and 4 rebounds in 10 minutes vs. Maryland (1/14)

2 points and 1 rebound in win vs. Michigan State (1/11)

2 rebounds,1 assist, and 1 block in 6 minutes at #1 Purdue (1/5)

2 points, 2 rebounds and 1 assist in just 4 minutes vs. Northwestern (1/2)

Team-high 19 points (9-10 FGs) and 6 rebounds (5 offensive) vs. FDU (12/29)

Tied a season-high with a game-high 8 rebounds vs. Colgate (12/17)

2 points, 3 rebounds and a block in just 4 minutes at #17 Tennessee (12/9)

4 points (2-2 FGs) with one rebound and a block in win vs. #11 Florida Atlantic (12/5)

4 points, 4 rebound in just 8 minutes in reserve role at Rutgers (12/2)

Season highs of 16 points and 8 rebounds in third straight start vs. Western Illinois (11/24)

12 points on 5-7 FG vs. Southern (11/19)

Season-high 16 points with 7 rebounds and 2 blocks vs. Valparaiso (11/17)

10 points and 7 rebounds, and 1 block vs. Oakland (11/10)

8 points, 6 rebounds, 1 block and 1 steal in opener vs. Eastern Illinois (11/6)

2022-23 Sophomore

Illinois’ No. 4 scorer and No. 2 rebounder, averaging 9.5 ppg and 5.5 rpg

Shot 63.6% from the field (131-206), second in B1G in 2-point percentage

Ninth in Big Ten, (third on the team) in blocked shots (1.2 bpg)

13 points, 7 rebounds and 2 assists in Big Ten Tournament vs. Penn State (3/9)

12 points and four rebounds in win over Minnesota (2/20)

11 points and 5 boards at #14 Indiana (2/14)

15 points (7-12 FG) and seven rebounds in win over #24 Rutgers (2/11)

17 points on 7-11 FG and game-high 9 rebounds at Iowa (2/4)

9 points, 8 boards and 2 blocks in win at Wisconsin (1/28)

11 points on 5-6 FG in win at Minnesota (1/16)

20 points (8-12 FG, 4-5 FT) with 7 boards and two blocks in win over Michigan State (1/13)

9 points, 9 rebounds and 3 blocks at Northwestern (1/4)

Career-high 22 points (8-10 FG) with 4 blocks and 4 steals vs. Bethune-Cookman (12/29)

9 points and six rebounds in win over #2 Texas (12/6)

13 points on 6-6 FG in win over #8 UCLA (11/18)

20 points and career-high 15 rebounds and 5 blocks vs. Kansas City (11/11)

17 points and 10 boards for first career double-double in UI debut vs. Eastern Illinois (11/7)

2021-22 Freshman

Appeared in Baylor’s first three games of the season, totaling six points and three rebounds in nine minutes, before electing to transfer

Transferred to Illinois at the semester break and practiced with the Illini during the spring semester

2020-21 Redshirt (at Baylor)

Sat out the season as a redshirt during Baylor’s run to the 2021 NCAA Championship

High School

Four-star, top-100 recruit in Class of 2020, ranked No. 52 by ESPN and No. 91 by 247Sports

Led Park Center to a 23-5 record, conference title, and 5AAAA section final as a senior before the season was cut short by the COVID-19 pandemic

Second-team All-State by the Associated Press

Minnesota Basketball Coaches Association All-Star Series green team

All-Northwest Suburban West Conference Team

Personal

Born July 16, 2002 in Chicago

Majoring in communication

Parents are Baba Dainja and Latasha Kilgore

Father played college basketball at Minnesota from 1990-93

Hobbies include fashion, clothing and photoshoots

Biggest sports achievement is earning a scholarship to play college basketball

Favorite athlete is Carmelo Anthony

Favorite artist is Young Dolph

Enjoys soul food

Lists his father as the person who has most influenced his basketball career, “He brought the game to me and worked with me.”

Chose Illinois because, “It’s the best place for me with my type of game, and getting my body right working with Fletch. He’s the best in the country.”
